That time of Year when th' Earth grand Parent shews;</br>Doth beauties choice, new flaunting Brood disclose:</br>When paints her Cheek, with Gems adorn'd (as 'twere)</br>Imbroidered Garb; may Curtisan appear:</br>Whilst, more advanc'd, the Sun with wanton eye,</br>Much fonder ray doth Court her from the Sky,</br>Smiling in Beams:  when spruce-drest Groves abound;</br>Thro chirping Consorts noise withal resound,</br>Sweet Songs of joy:  Heaven chearful, pleas'd survay'd;</br>Cloud-marks discharg'd, bright, azure Face display'd,</br>Dropt pearly Dews; then free from Congelation;</br>The World restor'd since former Youth's privation.

No sooner had the Lady Morn in state,</br>Usher'd by Star, walk'd forth her Eastern gate;</br>From glorious Couch Rose-spread to take the air,</br>That still might seem with blushing Cheeks more fair;</br>Scatt'ring her Dew like Crystal Pendents round,</br>As Favours to adorn the fruitful Ground:</br>But straight beheld on large Ortesian Plain</br>(Prime Rendevouz) great store o'th Pastor-train,</br>Choicest Arcadian youth, most active Men,</br>Each walking from their Country-grange as then.</br>Young Females (last) conjoyn'd, that gaudy Day</br>Quick, early Risers too, but mirthful Play</br>Was their chief end, supreme; and more to grace</br>PAN'S Festival, stil'd God of Sheep, that Place,</br>Each  Shepherdess shew'd trim'd and beautifi'd</br>With handsom Garb; careless, neglected Pride;</br>Nice, formal freaks of Art could shun, forbear,</br>Tho flaunting too:  good skins and Features there:</br>As Nature thought to th' World it should be known,</br>She was not ti'd to gorgeous Courts alone.

Let it suffice, some had the name of Fair,</br>Might Princes please:  Young Pastors too did share</br>For manlike Form, ingenuous Parts combin'd:</br>Tho Shepherds call'd not prov'd of servile kind</br>(Since kept their Own or Fathers Flocks) but there,</br>Like Graziers now, gentiler Stamp did bear. . . .</br>
